posts.content:
The Harper Galloglas: Bard 29 / Harper 1 / Fighter 10 by grizzled_dwarflord

I found the above build on the search engine and I've decided I would very much like to try something similar to it, preferably DEX-based, Human w/ an emphasis on Bard levels. However, there are a few things I'm uncertain on. Is Lasting Inspiration really that useful for something you've got so many casts of per day, especially in a build like this? Also, will I be able to get my Perform high enough with items and such on WoG for a level 29-30 Bard Song? Any build recommendations are totally welcome, as always, thanks folks.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hmm, from where to start...

Okay the easy things first. In general playing at (low/medium) magic worlds you will want to go STR-based unless there is a particular reason for it to do otherwise. GDL was notorius in his use of STR-based assassins or SD's even and the build you were looking at, is also STR-based as well. Now if you plan to play him as an archer you obviously go DEX-based (or in a high magic world) but apart from that there is really no reason to go for dexterity as main stat, especially with the great AC of an epic bard. Again, those are general guidelines but i believe you get my point.

Now let me talk to you for bards. Originally i was against playing bards till i tried Kail's Black Wind -> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 93865.html and i loved it.
After that nothing again was the same, i deviced my own bard to play -> moghedien-melody-of-the-dark-bard-26-bg-4-rdd-10-t2350150.html and went drunk in power.
Then played a pure bard even (i will post one at yardstick's build section later) and my whole party loved me so much that... i played another one! Mind you this is four times bard at forty and i still didn't want to change.
Really what there is to say for The-Best-Buffer-Hands-Down-In-Game?

I mean, apart from the whole 6th lvl of bard spells, you have your epic song and after that UMD to use all the other spells you might want, save a few (magic vestment for example-damn clerics). You will love it, your party will love you more than that!

Now for the perform thing. Normally you won't be able to reach the 100 perform that is required for the full lvl 30 bard song. Unless you know item specifics and i won't get into that here, but getting the 80 perform for the lvl 26 bard song it sure not only possible but easy as well. And the lvl 26 bard song is super strong anyway. You won't need anything more than that really. Going to 80 perform is a simple matter of 43 (ranks) + 9 (buffed CHA) + 10 (ESF: perform) + 30 (Epic gloves of minstrel). Heh, that's 92 right there, so you can do it even without buffed CHA anyway. So yeah, it is very much possible to fully utilize a lvl 28 bard song or so and your Curse Song will be even higher than that. Don't be afraid to go bard heavy in WoG at least.

And for the last part, if Lasting Inspiration is worth it, i would definitely say, YES! Having all those buffs pretty much constantly on you and your party is well worth it. And don't forget Curse song de-buff too. You see, the difference is huge man, the normal song lasts 10 rounds and the lasting one 100 rounds, that's ten times more and ensures that all those buffs are all the time ON. It's like you have permanent magic items on you that give you all these buffs.

I will close with some additional DEX-based builds this time, just in case you want to see one. Now full tumble ranks + bard song + dex build + epic dodge + uncanny dodge, pretty much means that you will only get hit from spells.
Here is a Bard/Ftr/RoGue -> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 70617.html
And here is a very nice combo that uses DM to get damage in a DEX-build -> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 98223.html
And there are many more from here too, but we don't have a search engine so it's kind of difficult right now to link one. Max has his skeletal musician (no LI though) and another bard too, but i think i already gave you much food for thought already.

I do not know if this is good enough to post it on the 40's section, but it is the closest to what you asked in case the other options i linked did not stir your imagination.

The meaning of this build is all about options, she can wear her full plate and tower shield for maximum defense (but she already has very good AC without those) OR she can dual-wield perfectly her twin shortblades in a quicker-than-the-eye motion to dispatch her foes more quickly. She can set all deadly traps, she can buff herself and a whole team practically forever (240 min is about 3 whole days duration in NwN), she can curse to turn tough foes into jellies, she can identify everything she meets, she has full Bard spells on top of that, she can use any item in the game and so on...I think you don't need me to illustrate, how she can reach a 47 AC & 61 AB with nothing but mundane items. Yeah, epic Bards are that powerful, and more actually.

* Her initial build had 2 more STR (32) but i decided against that since this one offers more power earlier. If you want i can show how you can achieve her original power.

Anyway, i hope you like her

posts.author: JimDandy
posts.content: I'm confused about when a caster is undispellable; you say level 24 here, but I've understood it as level 26 for all casters (Mord's being the spell that can strip anything). Do you mind elaborating?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
It is level 24 but usually when we build caster/ warriors we go to a 26/ xx/ yy split simply because at 26th you get the second bonus feat as well.

The dispel check that is used is D20 + Caster Level (maximum of 15 for greater dispel)  VS  Your Caster Level + 12. So, at the worst case scenarion they can make a (20 + 15 = 35 Penentration check). You need (24 caster level +12) = 36 to be untouchable.


Hope i helped,
